lines.text: Good afternoon, sir. Crew's compartment ready for inspection. Harris, Gunner's Mate Second, standing by.
Good afternoon.
[He looks around, and then opens one of the lockers. On the inside of the door is a picture of a luscious pin-up girl]
Somebody's kid sister?
Sorry, sir.
He's very sorry, sir.
Oh, no, no. Don't apologize... the most seaworthy thing I've seen on this boat.

[reporting aboard the PT109]
Mr. Kennedy? Ensign Leonard Thom, your exec.
[they exchange salutes]
Oh, hi. Glad to meet you, Leonard.
[they shake hands]
Welcome aboard.

[looking around the boat]
How long did they give you to put it in shape?
Well, we've used about half the time just talking right here.

[reading a brief on Kennedy]
Seems like all he ever did was go to school. He's had no sea duty. Says here he wrote a book.
Sounds like he oughta be in charge of a library.
What's the name of the book?
'Why England Slept.'

[around a cigar stub]
Got any pictures in it?
Pigeons?
Pictures, idiot!
He's lookin' for pictures and I'm an idiot.
